fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23983].
  {panel}

This bug only affects and selection and copying of the last row of a table. All other rows are fine. 

Steps to reproduce: 
# copy the last row of a table
# insert a blank row after the last row
# position the cursor in the first cell of the newly inserted row
# paste

This will cause the collective contents of last row that was copied to be all _squished_ into the first cell of the new row that was inserted.
fields.summary: Allow copy and pasting of the last row (or selections involving the last row) in webkit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23925].
  {panel}

When Editing UD of type 'Internal with LDAP Authentication' it does not expose the "Enable Nested' field.
Please enable Support of Nested Groups for this type of UD.

We are forced to use this type of UD since we are a large institution and embedded crowd is 'greedy'. Our ADS Directory is extremely huge and even though we only use several hundred existing ADS groups for privileges in Confluence they are from across the spectrum of OU's, therefore UD Group LDAP filter configuration cannot limit embedded crowd from attempting to copy/sync a huge portion of the entire AD directory (even though most AD users and groups have nothing to do with Confluence software anyway).

Thanks,
Craig
fields.summary: Support of Nested Groups for Internal Directory with LDAP Auth.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23917].
  {panel}

Requested feature:
Allow to switch the wiki full text search into a "layman mode", where it finds anything containing the entered text as or WITHIN a word, equivalent to a search for "*asdf*" in Windows explorer.

Background:
I have observed that new Confluence users often enter parts of words in the search field and then complain because the wiki doesn't find the pages having words *containing* this part.

A typical example is the german word "Kanalhaltung" (engl. sewer pipeline). People often just look for "Haltung" or "Kanal" or "Kanalhalt" and simply expect pages containing "Kanalhaltung" to be found. Especially the typical German compound words are susceptible to this problem.

The average user doesn't know about wildcards and doesn't want to use them.

I am aware that such a search would be significantly slower, but for our users getting *all* results is far more important than getting *quick* results.

(This issue is crucial for user acceptance by our customer for which we intend to install it as a documentation system.)

Matthias Basler
fields.summary: Have more intuitive full text search ("layman mode")

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23913].
  {panel}

Steps:
1) Edit a wiki page with a link
2) Click on the link
3) In the Edit Link dialog, try to edit the link text
Result: the link text is not editable here

It can be hard to edit the link text in the editor. Where does the link begin and end? This is why Word and other editors let you edit link text in the dialogs, not just in the editor.

Confluence should enable editing of the link text in the dialog.
fields.summary: Enable editing link text in "Edit Link" dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23912].
  {panel}

A documentation site usually offers different versions of the documentation to support different versions of the product. This is because customers upgrade to the latest release at different times.

Technical writers often organise the different versions of the product documentation in different spaces.

When a person comes to the documentation wiki, it would be nice to ask them which product and which version they need. One implementation could be a dropdown list at the top of every page (in the page header) which allows the user to select the product and version that they are interested in.

This would be useful as part of the Confluence Documentation theme. For example, the theme could offer another configuration option: Request product/version information Yes/No. It could also allow the administrator to specify the space(s) applicable to each product/version, which would populate the dropdown list offered to the user.

This idea can apply to more than just versions of the product. For example, the space administrator could use the option to offer specific documentation for different configurations of the product or different platforms.
fields.summary: Prompt user for product and version in Documentation theme

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23907].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence and would like to send email-notifications as plaintext with the changed content.
Today this is sent with HTML (and not possible with plaintext), where the changed content is highlighted in green. As this is done with CSS in the HTML, emailreaders will not be able to translate this into plaintext, forcing our users to view the emails as HTML.

Our request is to get an email like this: 

User [username] changed the page [page name]
Comment: [comment]
--------------------------------------
\- Roses are blue violets are green
+ Roses are red violets are blue
And so are you
Loreum ipsum lori di sa dor
\- Ipsum la mi da sorium 
+ Hipla dopla dei
[...]
--------------------------------------

Very much like the 'git diff' og 'svn diff'. Is this possible?
fields.summary: Changed content email in plaintext

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23899]. {panel} h3. User story A user inserts a numbered bullet list, types in one item, then presses ENTER. The RTE at this point produces: {code} 1. first point 2. CURSOR HERE {code} What they want is to continue adding text and content after the first bullet. They aren't ready for the second yet. In wiki markup they would just: {code} # first point keep typing more stuff here which would be part of the first point {code} The solution of course is SHIFT + ENTER. However, a majority of users aren't aware of this. [One example|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/20874/numbered-lists-break-when-you-remove-the-numbering-function-from-lines-in-the-sequence-that-do-not-need-to-use-numbers]. We could adopt the stance that we need to train / educate users. But I think there's a still better way, and MS Word has implemented it, and I think its brilliant. h3. Suggestion When the RTE shows: {code} 1. first 2. CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE - second 3. third {code} If the user hits backspace, they get: {code} 1. first CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE - second 2. third {code} Note: # numbering has been restored (so (3) becomes (2)) # the contents of second bullet has been moved to the first. # the user doesn't have to know about SHIFT + ENTER. Backspace is what I've seen a few people doing intuitively to remove the bullet style. Lets give them that instead. Technically the DOM should be: {code}
  1. first
    second
  2. third
{code}
fields.summary: Backspacing a bullet item should remove the bullet style only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23861].
  {panel}

Too often in support cases we feel like Vogons explaining to Earth why their planet is about to be destroyed:

{quote}
There's no point in acting all surprised about it. All the planning charts and demolition orders have been on display in your local planning department in Alpha Centauri for fifty of your Earth years, so you've had plenty of time to lodge any formal complaint and it's far too late to start making a fuss now.
...
What do you mean you've never been to Alpha Centauri? For heaven's sake mankind, it's only four light years away you know. I'm sorry, but if you can't be bothered to take interest in local affairs that's your own lookout.
{quote}

For whatever reason, our documentation is skipped which leads to disappointment, confusion and sometimes anger, especially considering there's no easy roll back process.

I propose two things:

# Work to improve and simplify our documentation so it's easily read and understood
# Request acknowledgement of the release notes/documentation prior to starting an upgrade task

While we obviously can't avoid the problem entirely, this should at least minimise the amount of confused customers who upgrade to a new version and discover that their favourite feature has been removed or altered. Obviously the onus is then on us to ensure that the documentation is easier to read and follow so that it's not simply skipped over.
fields.summary: Acknowledgement of documentation prior to upgrading

fields.summary: OOME when converting large Word document to HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23826].
  {panel}

Heading formats will not render if wiki-markup is preceeded by a space

i.e.
{noformat} h1. JoeyC's Excellent Adventure{noformat}

Keeping this as minor as this scenario is unlikely. That is, I can't think of a scenario where a user would want to put a space before using the heading

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
(/) Stable
h6. Browsers
(/) IE8
(/) IE9
(/) FF8
(/) Chrome
fields.summary: Heading autoformatting will not render if preceded by a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23825].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Apply a heading format to text (either by shortcut or toolbar)
# Start a new line

*expected:* format returns to "Paragraph" on new line
*actual"* heading format persists

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
(/) Stable
h6. Browsers
(x) IE8
(/) IE9
(x) FF8
(x) Chrome
fields.summary: Can't escape heading formatting by starting a new line on IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23823].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce: 

# create a table
# inside a cell, create a bullet (press the toolbar button)
# press backspace

You won't be able to backspace remove this bullet.
fields.summary: Can't delete first bullet in table cell on webkit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23822].
  {panel}

Confluence administration allows you to create a user without an email address.
When you attempt to share a page with a user that doesn't have an email address, you get the feedback below.
!111110_vagueFeedback.png!

I am not sure if the problem here is
* the vague error message
* the fact that we can create a user without an email address (and that when you edit the user, email address is a mandatory field)

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
Stable
h6. Browser
IE8
IE9
FF7
Chrome
fields.summary: Vague feedback when attempting to send email who does not have an email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23821].
  {panel}

When user attempts to share a page with another user, the display picture of the sharee (?) is not rendered.

These users had the default display picture

This issue may exist in IE8 but investigation is blocked by [CONF-23819|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23819]
*In IE9*
!111110_displayPicNotShown.png!
*In FF7
!111110_noDisplayPicInFF.png!
fields.summary: Display pics do not render on Share Button for FF7 or IE9
On blog posts the created date should be shown
Why has the ability to edit a page in "wiki markup" been taken away?
Editing Page Issues
Make it easier to edit the built-in groups confluence-administrators and confluence-users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23812].
  {panel}

h2. Problem description

This error occurs only for new installations of 4.0.3 where, in the setup wizard, the user has opted to install the demo space. 

h2. Steps to reproduce

# Install a clean instance of Confluence 4.0.3, and choose Demo space during load content
# Access the Demonstration Space, and go to {{Browse>Space Admin}}

h2. Workaround

The workaround for this issue is to rename it directly from the database. You could do it by executing this SQL query

{code:SQL}
UPDATE spaces SET spacename='<your preferred name'> WHERE spacekey='ds';
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23778].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

When a page is exported as PDF, special characters like Ω and µ are omitted.

h3. How to reproduce

# Create a page, and include special characters like Ω
# Save the page, and then 'Export as PDF'
# In the PDF file, the 'Ω' character is completely missing

h3. Findings

I have tried this in Confluence 4.0.3, 4.0, 3.5.9, 3.4.9, 3.3.3, 3.1.2 and 3.0.0_01. All of these versions suffer from the same problem. Have tried disabling and re-enabling the PDF Export plugin, then restart Confluence instance, but problem persists.

This is how it looks like in the editor :
!PDF export editor.png|thumbnail!

This is what happens after it is exported as PDF :
!PDF export result.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

Upload a font that contains these symbols to Confluence, as detailed in [CONF-25887|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25887].
fields.summary: PDF export omits special characters like µ and Ω

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23741].
  {panel}

The old Confluence LDAP connector supports multi-valued fields.
The new LDAP connector does not and Confluence shoud regain that feature, as it helped really much in an organization where multiple userdirectores get combined into one big directory.

Here is an example of the LDAP fields where a user would have three different logins which all refer to the same identity:
CN=E01010101
Loginnames=user@domain.com
Loginnames=DOMAIN_A.USERNAME
Loginnames=DOMAIN_B.USERNAME

Groupmembership is searched via CN. Confluence searched the Loginnames field for checking the credentials and getting the comlpete DN for groupsearches (for instance: cn=E01010101,ou=users,dc=domain,dc=com).
Confluence 3.2.1 works very well with this setup, looking up the correct user information by CN.
Confluence 3.5.13 only finds user "Domain_B.USERNAME".
fields.summary: Multi Valued RDN for LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23730].
  {panel}

I've found a couple of quick-win performance improvements that can be made to the General Configuration page in Confluence's admin console.

* GeneralConfigurationAction.getSiteHomePages is invoked on view operations, even though it's only needed on edit. This appears to be laziness on the part of webwork. Easy optimisation.

* GeneralConfigurationAction.getSiteHomePages performs at least 1, sometimes 2 individual permission checks on every single global space in the system. On systems with lots of spaces, this quickly fails to scale. The purpose of the permission check is to ensure that the Administrator is not able to set the site home page to a page that is not accessible to all users. This is a computationally expensive operation for small benefit. We could drastically improve the performance (with a slight usability cost) by changing the permission checking to occur 'on-save' rather than 'on-load', reducing the complexity of the operation from O\(n) to O(1).

* GeneralConfigurationAction.doDefault makes multiple calls to settingsManager.getGlobalSettings which involves a call to the BandanaManager each time. It should just retrieve the global settings once for the duration of the request.


h3. Patch
There is a patch available for Confluence 3.5.13 > 3.5.17. Please be aware that this is not tested and you use it at your own risk. The preferred fix for this issue is to upgrade to Confluence 4.1 or above.

Download the attached file ([CSP-68093-2.zip|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/91321/CSP-68093-2.zip]) and extract it into your Confluence's WEB-INF/classes directory, ensuring to preserve the folder paths in the zip file. At this point your WEB-INF/classes directory should contain this (in addition to what was there already):
{code}/WEB-INF
  /classes
    /com
      /atlassian
        /confluence
          /admin
            /actions
              GeneralConfigurationAction.class
              GeneralConfigurationAction-validation.xml{code}
You'll need to restart Confluence in order to pick up these changes, at which point your troubles will hopefully be gone! 

NB: This means it is now possible for an Administrator to accidentally set the site home page to a page that is not viewable by all users.
fields.summary: Performance improvements for /admin/viewgeneralconfig.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23729].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# In IE, create a new page.
# Create a rich-text macro, such as \{info}.
# Inside the macro, type out a few words. Don't start a new paragraph.
# place your cursor between two words in your sentence.
# press enter.

The expected behaviour would be that everything to the right of the cursor is placed on a new line. What actually happens is the cursor moves, but the text stays in the single paragraph.

Furthermore, if you place additional content on that single paragraph (perhaps you backspace a paragraph in to it), that text will be trapped inside that paragraph, too.

This only seems to occur with rich-text macro bodies. Plain-text macros such as the code block do not exhibit this behaviour.
fields.summary: First paragraph of a macro in IE traps your macro's body text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23727].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
find a page to share
click the share button
paste an email into the autocomplete field and press space before the autocomplete has a chance to suggest any values
delete the space, auto complete will not suggest a value to add
retype the email into the share box, auto complete will not suggest a value to add

This is not limited to pasting an email, can reproduce this by typing an email if you pause after typing the full email and then press a space.  

I can reproduce this on EAC, may need to slow the process down if running locally.

To work around this, refresh the page that you want to share, and do not put any whitespace after the email address in the autocomplete field.
fields.summary: Share button autocomplete can get in a state where it will not share with a particular email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23720].
  {panel}

When browsing Confluence, larger images can slow the loading of pages and make Confluence feel sluggish.  In order to combat this, users will edit images in a desktop application to reduce file size before imbedding the image in a Confluence page.

What we would like to see is the option to have Confluence do the compression for us as the image is uploaded.  An analogous situation would be how a smart phone will reduce the resolution of a picture before being sent in a text message.  Below are potential features we would like to see.

-The option to set a maximum KB size for images and automatically edit images to fit this requirement upon upload
-The option to have the compressed image displayed on the page but still have the original image available for download

The ultimate goal being to reduce the complexity of making sure images on pages do not slow the Confluence end user experience.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Cheers,
Andrew Campbell
Atlassian Support, San Francisco
fields.summary: Compress images when uploading to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23711].
  {panel}

Embedded Crowd should only copy or sync groups that actually serve a purpose within Confluence (or Jira). Currently all groups of every user are synced. Only a very small percent of these groups are actually used by Confluence for Space or Page restrictions. 

Its very likely that Confluence DB could easily keep track of the groups that are actually used for Space or Page restrictions then embedded crowd only copy/sync those.

Our LDAP is huge, and we are not able to restrict group filter by OU or group name because the groups that are used by confluence to control permissions are scattered, and not in our control to duplicate or rename. Implementation of embedded crowd copied many thousands of groups into Confluence for absolutely no purpose within Confluence. This is a huge security concern as well as a deviation from an otherwise stellar product.

Login was taking upwards a minute because embedded crowd was attempting to sync massive groups that serve absolutely no purpose within Confluence. Once the group filter excluded these login dropped to an acceptable duration, but still thousands upon thousands of groups are sync'ed for no reason at all. Editing the UD group filter is very difficult when one wishes to negate most of their entire LDAP!

PLUS a GROUP SEARCH filter is very badly needed on the Manage Groups page!


Thank you,
Craig
fields.summary: Embedded Crowd should only copy or sync groups that actually serve a purpose within Confluence.
Renaming "Show Descendents" option in Children Display Macro to "Show All Descendents" option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23709].
  {panel}

h3.Problem.

Links that are from Confluence itself, or placed by user should be redirected instead of a direct link.

e.g. http://www.google.com should be https://myconfluence.com/?redirect=http://www.google.com

This would avoid security checks from browser and would avoid annoying warnings.
fields.summary: Links from External reference should be redirected instead of direct link, due security matters.
